review: Topamax (topiramate):I took this for 5 days and nearly tore my hair out.  So much nervousness, anxiety, dizzy, nauseated and tired!  I cannot function on this pill.  25 mg per day and the doctor told me to increase to 100 mg per day.  I think  I would have died and plus, IT does NOT work

Definitely helped reduce migraines and seemed to have a positive effect on my seizures — I haven’t had one since I started in February 2020. The weight loss is a nice addition, too. However, I now have long-term memory loss and occasional slowed thinking and difficulty finding words. I wasn’t a genius before, but I definitely feel dumber now. I know now why they call it Dope-a-max. I would try something else due to that but I know the weight will come back on once I go off of it and I don’t want to mess with my migraines possibly starting back up. So I guess I’ll continue to be a skinny, migraine- and seizure-free idiot. Insert shrug emoji here, amirite?!

Topamax (topiramate):40 (F). Started taking 100mg Topamax daily (50mg morning, 50mg at night) as a migraine prevention drug when nothing else worked (I have cluster headaches, migraine with aura and have experienced seizures during attacks). Works brilliantly for me and I now get few migraine attacks (I used to suffer severely). Initial side effects included parathesia (tingling of hands/feet), soda being a bit weird (less 'bubbly') and some weight loss (2kg, or 4lb, a month). Topamax also had a very positive effect on my Bipolar Disorder! I have Bipolar 1 and it is very treatment resistant. It is often used off-label as a mood stabiliser. I did not know this until others commented how unusually 'calm' and focused I seemed. Only downside: potential kidney effects. I have had prior kidney infections & stones, but recent scans show benign cysts & tumours. Not sure if it is the Topamax use; so something to consider here.

Topamax (topiramate):I was having headaches almost every day so my doctor sent me to neurologist he suggested this medicine it has helped my headaches the only side effects for me is the sodas taste nasty and I have lost of appetite

I have been on this drug for severe migraines since I was thirteen. I used to praise it as the thing that saved me, however all I knew was that my headaches were going away, and I was having less migraines. The first year on the drug started with numbness in my fingertips and the zygomatic area of my face (cheekbones) as well as my calf. Mid way through the first year, my appetite disappeared for a few months, I had no desire to eat— one of the strangest feelings I’ve ever had. Eventually, the numbness side effect went away and I forgot about Topamax side effects for a year. Then at 15 years old I developed terrible dry eye, later diagnosed as inflammation. At 18 that eye is significantly blurrier. I cannot stay awake on this medication, nor to this day comprehend what people are saying or form coherent thoughts at the height of brain fog. I’ve started another medication to counteract the effects of this drug. Hear me out!!
Just started taking this for headaches, only been on it 3 days hoping it works and I lost 3llbs

I took topiramate 200 mg for migraine prevention for a few months. It wasn't very effective for me, so I discontinued.I haven't experienced any bad side effects. I remember I was very reluctant to try this at first. Instead I haven't felt anything at all. Only at 200 mg I started perceiving little "lights" in my field of vision, mostly peripheral. But it wasn't a deal breaker -- if this was effective I would have stayed on it despite this minor visual disturbance.I don't know if this is relevant, but after trying several medications within several classes of drugs, I noticed that I seem to tolerate antiepilectics very well, while with antidepressants I get very bad adverse reactions.

Okay listen. Topiramate IS NOT INTENTIONALLY MADE FOR MIGRAINES. It is not. Doctors should never put mentally stable people on this drug. I have BPD, Bipolar 1 and many other illnesses, and I happen to get chronic headaches. Topiramate, helps people with mental issues and seizures. It has helped me with the leveling of manic and depressive episodes as well as my migraines. If you're reading this, on topiramate, and not mentally ill, get off it. Your brains chemistry is FINE. If you take this drug, you might mess up  your levels up and cause damage. so, take it from someone who needs this drug, if you have any harmful side effects (which just by the way, I've never encountered any) it's not worth it. Okay thanks for reading

Topamax (topiramate):I have visual migraines and paranoia about taking new  medication so I started at 12.5 and within a few days they were pretty much gone. I went up to 25 mgs and stayed there for about two weeks then started having some weird visual problems so I had to quit.  Works great though and was having appetite suppressant side effects as well so that was great!

I began taking this medication to prevent migraines and did not find it helpful in preventing headache. It had loss of memory specifically short term memory and some thinking processes. I found myself needing to be weaned from the drug as I was losing my thoughts and in a fog at 100 mg once per day tablet. It did not help my headaches and I am happy to not be taking this medicine. I am hoping after weaning off completely my memory and thought processes will return. I am scared they won't.

I was put on Topramax (Topiramax) 50mg morning & night to replace Tramadol, which made me gain weight, and didn't work. Plus gave me mood swings.Since being on Topramax, great side-effect is weight loss. My dr said I might lose some weight, but went from 94kg to 65kg in 6 or 7 months.I did eat healthier, but same as before and never lost this much.One thing I noticed at beginning: LOCALISED pain in my actual stomach a few time, so I just ate it with food or milk.Still on it now. Been 5 years :)

Topamax (topiramate):Started topiramate 25mg 20.9.2021 for hemiplegic migraines. Initially extremely anxious as I'm not keen on any new medication due to a bad experience with Ecstasy as an experimenting teenager. I mean I was seriously anxious not just nervous, I was expecting to potentially die after taking this medicine. Anyway I haven't died and unbelievably my migraines with I have had since 2010 have VANISHED. Its truly unbelievable, the first few weeks, food and fizzy juice tasted different BUT its all back to normal now! I'm totally normal as I was before, VERY rarely do my hands and feet tingle and sometimes I feel slightly out of body as if I'm watching myself from above ( morbid eh? ) but in all seriousness I can't believe how well this medicine has worked. I haven't even got onto the condition for what I was prescribed this medicine for! Hemiplegic migraines developed for me about a month before I started topiramate, what an absolutely awful experience that was! This medicine works!

I was so excited to try this drug. My enthusiasm didn't last long. I started on 25mg. Then went up to 50mg, I had three weeks migraine free at this dose and thought it was an absolute miracle.  After three weeks my migraine returned my doctor then put me up to 100mg. I stayed there for 3 months and absolutely nothing. My migraines were actually the worst they have ever been in my life. Not only that, not long after starting this drug I slipped into a deep depression. I have never had any trouble with my mental health in my life. After getting to 100mg I then became suicidal, it wasn't obvious at first but in the end I was having suicidal thoughts all day long. I knew this was a side effect of this drug but thought that once It started working for my migraines I would feel better. In the end it was too much and I made the decision to come off the tablets and I started to feel better. Please see a doctor if your mental health deteriorates on this medication.

Topamax (topiramate):I was on it for less than a month in 2019 and it was AWFUL. I had every side effect imaginable. I was tired, my anxiety was worse, no appetite, food tasted weird, I had issues controlling my temper. I  thought I was going crazy. My boyfriend and I broke up for a week because of how I was acting and we didn't know any of this was a side effect of the meds till I went off of it because of the other side effects.

I had a severe allergic reaction to it. It all started out as tingling in my feet, then it went to my knees and my lips. It prevented my migraines but the side effects and the allergic reaction to it was not great considering I’m still suffering from it. It has ruined my memory. I started it 10/15/21 and stopped taking it 2 days ago due to finding out I was having an allergic reaction. I was on 50mg. It caused me to get blisters all over my hands, hives on my face, legs, arms, etc. it’s been 5 days and I’m still having an allergic reaction and they can’t even do anything for me. I couldn’t eat for days. I couldn’t get out of bed, plus it made me sneeze constantly. If you read online of all the side effects of what it can cause, I’m sure you wouldn’t want to take this. I’ve been on a lot of migraine meds to where half of them made me not be able to breathe but this one was the worst of them all. I don’t recommend this to anyone.

I’ve been getting migraines since I was a little girl - I’m 26 now. Last year I was getting roughly 20-25 migraines A MONTH. I begged my doctor for a solution and finally topiramate was introduced to me. I was prescribed 25mg - to be taken nightly before bed. Fast forward a year later… these laundry list of symptoms I’ve never had in my life: crippling anxiety, severe depression, numbness in my hands and feet, brain fog, inability to form sentences, emotional outbursts (followed by excessive crying), excessive urination, dry mouth, zero appetite, constant nausea, shivering when it’s normal temp, overly hot when it’s normal temp, cold sweats. I’m sure I’m forgetting quite a few more. Is having 1-3 migraines a month opposed to my regular 20-25 worth it with these side effects? ABSOLUTELY NOT. I rather have the migraines. I’m weaning off this drug as I type this. I want my life, body and mind back. Pray for me please.

I was on Topamax for 15 years. I was on it for migraine prevention  and it did slow down my migraines. I went from 15 to 18 a month to maybe one. It was a miracle drug for me!! But as most drugs do I had side effects of a mild headache daily, no appetite,  and after 21 kidney stones I said no more!! I weaned myself off it in about 3 weeks. My headaches returned and so did my appetite.  I have only gained 5 pounds but I have been surprised at how good food is again. It has been 3 months and I have tried other medications but so far haven't found anything that works as well. Hope my post helps others.

Topamax (topiramate):This has been terrible for me I've been on it for 2 weeks. I have every side effect and feel like a completely different person. I sleep all the time, don't feel like I can think or function, thirsty, short of breath, constantly confused. Doctor told me to stop medication, I'm hoping I feel back to normal soon

I took this for my chronic migraines (first 25mg, then up to 50mg). It did nothing for my migraines, sadly. My side effects were tingling hands/feet/face, like a pins & needles feeling. I also lost 25lbs in 3 months because I had no appetite. Also got severe depression while on this. I tapered off because I am already on the low BMI spectrum & was scared how much weight I lost. Had bad withdrawal symptoms - tremors, headaches, very cold, fever, extreme nausea, vomiting. My depression & appetite improved once I got off this drug.

2 years ago I was experiencing blurry vision in my left eye. Still ongoing tests with the help of my neurologist who put me on Topiramate. Throughout these two years I've gone from 25mg up to 200mg which I only started a couple of weeks ago. I'm now in my early 40's and since having my teenage son I was unable to shift the weight also. Before taking the Topiramate I was 16 & a 1/2 stone & only 5ft 4inc. Today I weigh 14 stone. I do have some side effects. Tiggles in my hands and feet & my nose gets runny or blocked up. I still get the occasional headache and I'm still having problems with vision and what I call 'episodes'. The doctor has ruled out diabetes, however MS runs in my family. But until I get my last results back from the hospital, I'm still baffled as to what is going on with me. I just thought that I would share my experience with you all.

Topamax (topiramate):I started taking Topamax to prevent migraines. I take Imitrex (triptans) as an abortive when I get full blown attacks but I was getting so many of them it was ridiculous and I was always running out of Imitrex. Let me say that Topamax is a tricky med that can have very weird/unpleasant side effects. Please use it with caution. I'm rather shocked to be reading that some patients have been prescribed starting doses of 200 mg daily. Yikes! That's high. I was put on 25 mg for 2 weeks then 50 mg for another 2 weeks and did quite well on those doses. However, when I hit 75-100 mg, I felt sick to my stomach so I barely ate anything. I was also very tired and lethargic. I waited a while, thinking the side effects might eventually go away. Apparently sometimes they do but in my case they didn't. I still felt really yucky so I was put back on 50 mg. So far so good and with fewer migraines and some pounds lost. Conclusion: I do horribly on the higher doses but great on the lower ones.

Topamax (topiramate):Not worth it! Took first pill this morning. This afternoon I noticed I have been foggy and lightheaded. Also made me very anxious and my resting heart rate has been around 100 all day. Normally around 75.

Topamax (topiramate):I have been on topamax for over a month. Migraines are almost gone. Not even taking pain meds that much. Weight loss is starting finally and it is happening quick. I am driving again and living the life I couldn't beforehand. I do have tingling in my feet and sometimes life feeling in a few toes, but for the lack of pain, I'll take it!

I took this for migraines then used it for binge eating disorder. It seemed to be okay for the first month, then it really kicked in. Awful! I fought with my husband all the time! Wanted to cry! Had to take hydroxyzine to counter the side effects!!!! Was Sooo moody I couldn’t even handle myself. I had to take myself off this one! Now I remember why I stopped taking it the first place. I feel like I will have to go on a mood stablizer to counter this one!The only positive is when I was in 50 mg it really helped control my appetite! I lost a few pounds

Topamax (topiramate):Caused retrograde ejaculation. Took this about a month, it worked great on me not getting my migraines BUT I started to notice that I was decreasing in ejaculation until there was nothing.... my vision got worse, got very dizzy and nervous at times.. I'm stopping this medication immediately.. just don't like these side affects..

Topamax (topiramate):Roughest 17 days of my life! I wanted it to work so so badly too as I am a lifelong migraine sufferer. I had constant head pain, crying bouts, insomnia, extreme heat all over my body. I couldn't even walk through a grocery store. It felt like everything was moving BUT me! I wrote my doc and told her I felt as though I was going to drive off a bridge and she immediately took me off. I started monthly injections and that's been better. I feel bad leaving such a bad review because this may work for some, but I felt it was important to leave my experience.

I have seizures  and migraines. I'm  already on several  seizure meds.  And one migraine med. Yet my Dr  prescribed  Topamax 50mg twice a day. It caused many side effects including  weight-loss  which the Dr never mentioned.  I've  noticed quite a bit of weight-loss.  I stopped taking it. Will I continue  to lose weight ? I don't want too.

This stuff is bad for me. Horrible side effects. I have only taken this a couple of times. The second time at half a dose before bed. Both times woke up numb tingling face and hands, thick lips and tongue, totally spaced out. Been dealing with migraine/tension type headaches for the past six months. Seem to be narrowing the cause to cervical problems (just had an MRI on my neck) yet the doctors keep wanting to treat it as if the source of my problems are stress or emotional issues. I am DONE with taking their mood altering medications. They all have bad side effects. So many of these doctors are being trained to treat every symptom with a pill ("it's all in your head") instead of looking a bit deeper and listening to what the patient is saying.

Topamax (topiramate):I have this for Cervicogenic headache. I had waves of lightheadedness the first week on this drug. Starting from the first day I took it. I also experienced tingling in my hands, but other than that the drug really worked well for me. The headaches disappeared and my head just felt much lighter. I didn't experience anything severe, nor loss of appetite, no changes in taste or concentration etc. After tapering down off of topamax; the constant headaches are back and I'm back to feeling miserable. I choose to quit because I don't like being dependent on such a potent drug and I don't want to eventually raise my dose because the drug has some scary potential side effects. Topamax is also dangerous in pregnancy and I'm worried about becoming pregnant unintentionally and having this drug in my system. But the drug itself was pretty great for me.

Topamax (topiramate):I was given Topomax about 2 months ago for recurring migraines; it did nothing but make my life . It a living nightmare.  I started with complete loss of appetite followed by extreme nausea. After that, the psychological effects started. I become extremely paranoid; The anxiety and paranoia got worse and worse the longer I was on Topamax which was soon accompanied by intense depression. Next came the hallucinations; I would see paintings moving on the walls, see colors and shapes moving across the floor, and I would hear voices multiple times a day.  I fully regret ever taking this drug, I want my life back.

Took for 3 months to get rid of rebound headaches and worked.  When Migraines came back, I started again to use as as a preventative, I ended up losing probably 30% of my hearing. (Rare side effect they say)Quit taking as soon as I figured it out.

Topamax (topiramate):I have been taking Topamax 50mg daily for a while without real results.  I recently upped the dosage to 100 daily and its really helping with migraines.  I have cut my 10 to 12 migraines a month to about 5 or 6.  I also reduced my caloric intake and sugar intake. I have reduced my processed food intake as well simultaneously while increasing exercise from moderate to moderately high.  I don't know exactly what has worked or the combination, but something is working and I will not change anything!

Topamax (topiramate):Migraines: I’ve been up and down doses from 25 mg to 100mg lost weight on the 100mg but felt shocking! Brain fog, irritation, food smells awful, no energy, anxiety, mood swings, suicidal etc then I cut right down to 25mg but my migraines come back and I’ve started upping it again and now on 50/75mg a day. But now back to all the symptoms I had before! It’s like a seesaw of finding the balance to be ok but I’m not hopeful.

I’ve been taking topiramate 25mg twice daily for a few months and have most of the side effects like the tingling and numbness of hands and feet, I can't put my thoughts, sentences and words together. The main side effect that  I’m struggling with is irritability, more like flat out aggression. Feeling like I’m watching myself live life. When I’m driving it doesn’t seem right! Ever since I started taking this medicine my perception has been off things don’t seem normal. Plus I can’t remember things and I’m on a low dose and I have started getting the migraines back. Eyes hurt like crazy. My experience with this medicine is not a pleasant one so far! It worked for the migraines for a little bit but not anymore. I feel sluggish and tied all the time. Sometimes I’m scared I’m feeling so much aggression I’m losing empathy!

So I was a bit intimidated by the potential side effects like tingling and yes I do get it, but it’s not as bad as I anticipated, it’s tolerable. It is definitely effective for me not just for migraines but for seizures, and suppressing appetite. It has also made soda and salt taste weird, and I make a lot of mistakes when I am speaking or trying to get a task done which is a little bit annoying, but I find it humorous. It’s curbing my weight gain that I couldn’t stop to save my life and starting to turn into weight loss which is a welcome effect, but the pins and needles can be pretty annoying at night. Drinking lots of water and ingesting lots of potassium works a little bit in my experience. For cognitive issues I noticed when I stopped using taurine and ashwagandha they got worse and I will be going back on those supplements. Over all, it could be worse in terms of seizure treatment for sure so I shouldn’t complain too much. It does the job

I started Topamax in July 2020, started on 25 mg twice a day and worked my way up to now taking 100 mg in the am and 100 mg in the pm. I had pretty severe migraines due to an enlarged pituitary gland. While at first I noticed a decrease in migraines that really helped, they did come back, but seemed to have subsided again which I am happy about. I was a huge coca cola addict, but this makes coke taste terrible so I stopped drinking it. I used to drink about 6 cans a day. Since October I've lost 22 pounds which I think is the combination of Topamax and the not drinking soda. I still don't eat really well, but deleting all of that sugar from my diet has been huge. I don't exercise really either. I'm still losing weight as well, which has me a bit concerned because I don't want to get much smaller than I am now. Wondering if anyone's weight loss took this long to set in from Topamax, or if maybe it's simply from not drinking soda. I'm not sure.

Topamax (topiramate):I started on 50mg with bizarre side effects and dropped to 25mg with almost perfect results . I say "almost" as I suspect some mild cognitive issues and mild fatigue on occasion. My migraine symptoms are caused by cervogenic issues: I need a c4/c5 cervical  fusion which I am hoping to get soon, and will allow me to discontinue generic topiramate. I suffered 3 migraines a week. I have had none in the 3 months @ 25mg dose. No more migraines, but I still have cervogenic headache that hopefully will be remedied by surgery. I give this drug a 7/10 due to all the folks that have had bad juju with it, and my mild apprehension of eventual withdrawal.

I was given Topiramate for headaches. It did somewhat help with headaches, but side effects were terrible!!  On 50 mg I experienced shortness of breath, psychomotor slowing, breast pain, flushing, awful mood swings, tingling in my hands and feet.  An ER Dr. told me the medicine would not cause psychomotor slowing.  I saw a neurologist who increased my dose to 100 mg. My most recent symptoms were pain/pressure in my eyes, forgetfulness, trouble sleeping, tingling in hands and feet worsened,  brain fog, memory issues I felt like I was going crazy!  I even had an abnormal EEG and a neurologist STILL said it wasn’t the meds. Convinced it was, I stopped the medication. I have only been off for three days and the tingling has stopped, pain/pressure in my eyes is gone. I feel more focused and like myself again.I am sleeping better and feel better overall. This is a terrible medication! Please be aware of the serious side effects!
I had no relief for migraine,  but it was freaking  great for weight loss.

Topamax (topiramate):I suffer from Migraines and peri menopause and started to suffer those extra pounds that just want come off and with migraines so hard to work out and go for walks and work out to get off the extra pound that pre menopause woman suffer from. I am 5'3 and always weight 120-125 and now weigh 140. Since I started on Topamax on February Dr put me on 25mg per day for 2 week, then increased it to 2x a day 3rd week.  Now its April 16 and weigh in - 125 back to my original weight. I feel back to normal. I have so much energy. I would say the only side effect I have is that I feel colder - my hands are cold and I'm more thirsty, again which is ok because I drink more water which is good because before I never drank water now I do.  My Migraines are hindered and I feel alive-

I have tried several preventable migraine medications and have some type of side effect or they don't work. I started Topiramate 25 Mg once a day about 6 months ago and thankfully haven't had a migraine since! I was getting the aura migraines about 5-6 times a week. I was hesitant about this medication due to some of the side effects I read. I didn't have any for the first 3 months but now some are starting to surface. My right hand has slowly been developing a tick that I can't control in my palm leading to my thumb. Each day it gets worse to the point its visibly pulsing almost 24/7 which is really annoying but I honestly would rather deal with that then get the migraines. I also have occasional tingling or needle like feelings in my hands and feet but nothing to get worked up about. Overall I would still consider this medication for migraine on a low dose and to take it before going to bed.

I was placed on topiramate tabs 4 months ago for prophylaxis starting with 50mg night and then maintaining at 100mg. I didn't have a single migraine in weeks. I however started experiencing virtually all its common side effects- mood swings, tingling sensations in my hands and feet, stomach cramps, short term memory loss, depression ( I became an emotional wreck, suddenly pining over my ex gfs), and the worst was the weight loss. I'm a naturally skinny guy. I'm 6 ft 3 and weigh 75kg (165lbs). At around the 3rd month of my Topiramate use, one of my buddies at work asked me if I was ill. He said I was getting too thin. When I got home, I weighed my self only to discover I now weighed 67kg (147lbs). My appetite has just gone since I started taking Topiramate and since the migraines have stopped, I've spoken with my neurologist and I'll be weaning myself off the drug gradually over about 4-8 weeks and hope my weight improves and I don’t ever need to use Topiramate in the future.

Topamax (topiramate):Genuinely an awful experience. Started on just 25mg, took it for just under 4 weeks, and nearly 2 months off it I'm still having side effects. I haven't seen much mention of this, but Topamax completely messed up my ability to taste/smell. Food and drinks I used to love were tasting and smelling utterly revolting. The taste problems have mostly faded since then but the smell issue in particular is still unbearable. Topamax is a neuro medication - and it can absolutely muck up your basic neurological functions. /Please/ try something else for migraines.

However, after a month these largely disappeared as have my migraines.  I plan to carry on for a few more months as my Dr said it can take 3 months for the benefits to be fully realized

Tried this last week to try to stop my migraines. I felt very weird the first day, but thought I would adjust to it. On the fourth day, there was no help with migraines, plus the weird feeling didn’t lessen. I couldn’t do very much while taking it.  Couldn’t drive or exercise. Even cooking dinner was uncomfortable. The feeling was like being dizzy/sleepy/intoxicated.

Topamax (topiramate):My Neuro started me on Topamax 25mg once daily for severe migraines. Within a few days, I was having severe irritability, anger with 'out of character' cursing (I cussed out a store clerk, a doctor's office receptionist, and my best friend), severe Labile mood changes, and a suicidal threat all within 7 days of my 1st dose! I quickly stopped the medication when I realized my symptoms were side effects of the Topamax! It was very dangerous for me and scared me!

Took it for about 4 months in 2010 for severe and persistent migraines. It completely got rid the migraines. I’ve had maybe 3-4 in the last ten years and they are nowhere near as bad as they used to be. Lost a SIGNIFICANT amount of weight while taking this. I wasn’t overweight, but I did become underweight. Hair loss was extreme. I have long and thick hair, it started falling out in clumps and took about 4 years to thicken back up after quitting. Coming off of the drug was one of the worst experiences of my life. Terrible depression and OCD. However, I did quit cold-turkey which is a no-no. Had a hard time recalling words while on the med. Could not think as fast or as clearly. But that weight loss, tho! I’m considering taking the drug again in 2021 because the weight loss was incredible, quick, and completely painless.

I had taken this medication for a year or so as a migraine preventative but had stopped due to pressure in my head and tingling. Fast forward 8 years or so my pain management dr wanted me to try it for peripheral neuropathy. Each dose causes extreme pressure in my head, tingling in my head & face and worsening of my chronic nerve pain. I actually can’t imagine a worse option for someone that’s learned to live with chronic pain than something that increases it and causes more pain. I’ve felt like I’m having a stroke for the past few days and this is following one dose.

Topamax (topiramate):I would use this medicine for migraine with great caution. It did help the pain eventually but the side effects and terrible withdrawal should be considered. I am glad l finally got off it but not without paying the price with time to get through the terrible withdrawal.

I was on this topiramate medication for just 2 weeks before I took myself off.  I was only on the lowest dose and I had horrible side effects. It started with nausea and the tingly hands, but then it caused breakthrough bleeding while on birth control at just 25mg (I was told it would be less effective at 200mg+). It caused vivid dreams, messed with my appetite, and I was not only extremely tired, but I couldn't sleep despite being so tired. It did, however, stop the migraines. But the side effects were not worth it for me to continue this medication.

I have tried just about every migraine medication in the book and topiramate was the worst.First day I felt like the whole world was full of static. My face went COMPLETELY numb for long bouts of time, longer than 24 hours at a time sometimes. After that I noticed a huge problem with brain fog and impairment of thinking. This drug is also known in (younger) migraine patients for causing severe mental health changes. I’ve known people who became suicidal within the first week and were relieved of depression when they stopped taking it.It did decrease my migraines some but did not stop them.

Topamax (topiramate):I was put on Topamax in September 2019 to treat lifelong migraines. I suffered very severe side effects across the board. My brain got foggy and I started dropping words or leaving sentences unfinished. I developed a skin reaction to metal and the skin peeled off under my wedding ring and where my bra clasp met my skin. The worst part was the crippling depression and anxiety. I spent hours crying. I developed such severe anxiety and insomnia that I stopped going to bed. I would just sit on the couch all night in a fog or fighting through panic attacks. I was prescribed Ativan to manage the anxiety. My GP put me on suicide watch and started to taper off the Topamax dosage. Before I was completely off, I developed an allergic reaction: my face, hands and feet swelled and I developed full body hives. I ended up in the ER where I was put on a high dose of steroids and anti-histamines. I went through horrible Topamax withdrawal, which left me nauseous and with the worst headache of my life.

I've had migraine for 50 years I've  tried lots of meds. None really did much I now use sumatriptan. I'm just getting over COVID had a chat with the doctor as I was having a lot of migraines with the coronavirus and fast running out of sumatriptan. Extremely effective. I had been non-functioning for a while and this drug was a dream. I had a horrible experience with Topamax...I went 72 hours without getting any sleep when I started taking it. Topamax (topiramate):This is the worst drug I've ever taken. It gave me horrible tremors, anxiety, & a guilt complex.

I went on topiramate January 2012 for migraines with positive results. By the end of  2012 I had lost 85lbs, and 7 dress sizes. I had started out at 235lbs and ended up at 150lbs. My dose started out 25mg twice a day, then went up to 50 mg twice a day in two weeks, then was increased to 100mg, twice a day in 3months. At the end of my treatment, my dose was 300mg daily.  I had also lost the ability to form sentences, because I couldn't find words, and was constantly in a fog. That is not good if you're a nurse. In the end I'd rather have the headache

I was on Topamax for over 15 yrs and am finally coming off of it. It seemed like a miracle drug for the first few years but soon started having major side effects. Please think twice before taking this med. This med cost me $187 when first started because they didn't have a generic but since They have generic now it cost me less than $2.00!!!

Topamax (topiramate):It lessened the frequency of my migraines. But the side effects are not worth the relief it provided. It turned me into a zombie. I didn't care about anything. I did not even know how bad my headache was for years and the ringing in my ears, I've started Topomax recently and I never realized how much pain I was in until the headache and the ringing was finally totally gone, I drink lots of water and less caffeine to prevent kidney stones. Topamax (topiramate):Horrible medication with tons of side effects. Throw this one in the waste basket and try the alternatives before touching this stuff.

I started taking Topiramate about a month ago for the prevention of headaches and migraines. No serious side effects, sometimes tingly in finger tips or right above upper lip for a few minutes.  Haven't had a migraine since being put on this medication!

Topamax (topiramate):This medicine gave me a kidney stone. They don't run in my family and I have never had one before. I've been on Topamax for 7 days now.. I started it last Tuesday and didn't notice the loss of appetite until Friday... I was given this drug for complex migraines and the morning after the first dose resulted in altered consciousness and anisocoria where the left eye was dilated and less reactive to light than the other eye. I weighed 268 pounds when I started out on Topamax about 12 years ago. I was put on them due to Cluster Migraines A/K/A Suicide Headaches. The level of pain I suffered daily was unbearable. I've suffered from chronic headaches/ migraines all my life and now being that I have finished  high school and moved to university the headaches would cause me to loose focus in university work. I was suffering from migraine, 10 times a month on average during late 2014. I have been always suffering from Migraine for years, but it was more frequently than before. I was put on topiramate for my chronic migraines. I have been taking it for 3.5 years and this was the third preventative medicine I tried. It works! I have had migraines all my life. I've been on topomax more then ten years. It has really helped me. Topamax (topiramate):Topamax is by far the best migraine preventative I have ever tried. I take 100mg at night and have even been on 200mg - 1 100mg in the AM and 1 100mg in the PM. Topamax (topiramate):I swear, this stuff almost ruined my life. I am a veteran who suffers from anxiety and chronic migraines from an injury in Iraq. I used to get migraines twice a week that would last a day or two. Now they're down to  two every two weeks that could possibly last a little more than a day.Topiramate really helped. I used to have 8 migraine days a month at the least last month I was down to 3. These side affects are worth it to me. but every case is different.

Topamax (topiramate):I was taking this medication for over two years had to stop it because my memory is terrible. Places I have been going for over ten years I forgot where they were and how to get there. This medicine has messed up my life, even after I stopped it my memory still hasn't returned. I deal with this everyday and it scares me so bad. I have to write things down everyday in order to remember. It did help with my headaches a little but if I had read up on this medication before I started I can promise you I would not have taken it.

Topamax (topiramate):I have suffered hormonal migraines since my early 20's (now early 40's). I had tried most everything for migraines and they were still coming and starting to cluster.  I was put onto Topirmirate by my GP at the recommendation of the specialist I saw after plan A stopped working after 6 months. I had some extremity tingling for about 6 weeks when I first started (I was slowly built up to 100mg daily dose).  In the interest of full disclosure I am also a type 1 diabetic so I am monitored pretty closely for sight and kidney function and I have had no issues around this. I have also started taking an anti depressant to combat a hormone imbalance issue so I don't get the mood swings either.

I have to say that the side effects are pretty harsh, but you have to remember that migraines are pretty debilitating and make life unbearable.  I'll take forgetting words rather than having 20 or more migraines a month. The first month of taking the med is the absolute worst, but your doctor should strongly warn you and advise you that this will happen and encourage you to work through it.  I kept remembering her words and am glad I did.  started slowly, with 25 mg in the morning, working up to 25 mg twice a day, then 50 mg at night with 25 in the morning, then up to 50 mg twice a day by the end of the month.  Never ever start bing bang boom all at once, or you won't want to continue.  Maybe for those who quit, you could try again.

Topamax (topiramate):The 2 weeks I was taking topamax ended up being the worst 2 weeks of my life. I was started on this med on Wednesday. Nearly wrecked and ended up in the ER where they diagnosed migraines. I finally figured out on MY OWN that when I stopped taking topamax, my symptoms got better. Although they are still not gone. My vision has changed as well as other long term effects.

Was rx'd for migraine control and prevention. Worked. But the painful tingling in my hands and feet was so extreme, I couldn't handle it. I was prescribed Topamax at 25mg 2 times a day by a family practice  Dr until I saw a neurologist and that Dr immediately increases my dose in a gradual dosage over a 2 week span to 200mg a day. Topamax (topiramate):I've read many of the poor reviews, and wonder how many refer to the generic version of Topamax. I can't use the generic version - it simply doesn't work for me, and I do recall more side effects. However, the brand name drug has been a lifesaver for me. I suffered with chronic daily migraine for over a decade before being placed on Topamax, and NO other drug helped. I was on beta blockers, calcium channel blockers, every medication for seizure disorders, and talk about side effects! They were horrific! I could barely function at work, missed lots of time, and essentially had no life. Topamax has made a major difference. I now have many fewer migraines, rarely contend with chronic daily migraine, and I've experienced no major side effects

Topamax (topiramate):I felt compelled to write a review, as I was on topamax (or should I say dopamax?!) for about 2 years. I started this medication when I was 21 and was so desperate to find something that would actually help my on-going migraines. Personally, the side effect symptoms FAR outweighed the benefits. I started out on 25mg a day and gradually increased to 100mg. As soon as I got on this, the side effects came rolling in. Before I knew it my memory was completely gone. In daily conversation I couldn't think of simple words, names or phrases. I knew what I wanted to say but couldn't form the words to do so. The worst of all, it really affected my grades in college. I used to have awesome memorization skills. Unfortunately I would study for hours upon hours, and still wouldn't do well as I would have "brain fog" during tests, etc. Another side effect I experienced was weight loss. I lost around 25 lbs., HOWEVER I don't believe all of this was ultimately from topamax. I'd definitely say it suppressed my appetite, but I really changed my eating habits and worked out daily. It helped with my first few pounds and got me motivated to do the rest. On the plus side, I saw a significant difference in the amount of migraines I received. It was a night and day difference in that aspect. However, approaching a year and a half on this medication I couldn't take it anymore and had to get off. It wasn't worth it anymore. I don't think tapering off or stopping cold turkey on this really makes a difference. My mom stopped cold turkey and I tapered off, as my doctor instructed me. I rebounded off this HORRIBLY, as did my mom. I was STARVING constantly after no longer taking it. This didn't just go away either. My body didn't feel levelled out and "detoxed" of this for honestly about a year after. I not only gained back all my weight I lost, but plus some. Although everyone's body reacts differently, I highly do NOT recommend taking this. Not even for those desperate for weight loss. Losing weight from a medication like this is not sustainable long term. I'm 24 now and am still affected by my choice of taking this. Topamax has ultimately ruined my memory to this day. I still cannot remember words or things. It changed me. Do not take this! There are other answers out there.

Topamax (topiramate):I've had migraines on and off for over a decade, and they're increasing with perimenopause. The first week went all right, though I had a migraine all through it. I had a second prescription for Sumatriptan to help. But 100 mg was... horrid. Tired, could hardly get out of bed, brain fog, physical fatigue (very evident at the gym), thirsty. After only 2 weeks I'm tapering off and seeing my doctor again to try something else.

Topamax (topiramate):I take 50mg at night because of drowsiness.The medication did help me with my migraines , I've only had a few since I started the medication.My side effects include, tingling in hands and feet, Red eyes, But the worst is the brain fog, trying to remember the simplest things are tough.  I have also noticed that I get angry about stuff more than I used to.

This medicine changed my life. I went from bedridden to active. I still get flare ups, but I can function in them now. My pain is greatly reduced. I solved that by cutting it short and dying it purple! In fact, I ended up on Topamax because my insurance wouldn't cover Lyrica. Best thing to ever happen to me since I became ill!

After many years onTopamax 100mg, eexcellent results for migraines, anxiety, depression, weight loss, now on generic Topiramate 300mg. Only keeps migraines at bay. No other good side effect. Gained back weight and stay depressed and anxious. Phcy. says it is the binders in the Rx.

I have just now started to lose weight after about 3 months or so of being on this medication for headaches.  I've started steadily losing ounces/weight.  I started out at 142 and over the past month I've dropped down to 134 which is unusual for me because I haven't changed my eating habits at all really except for the soda thing.  I'm okay with it all so far, but I hope I don't experience any other side effects like I typically do.
I fell two stories off a roof last year and had a traumatic brain injury which left me with migraine headaches all the time. Topamax did not help at all & I felt  more depressed. Use  with caution.

Topamax works wonderful for preventing my headaches.  I have had them since I was 4 years old.  I was only introduced to it when I was about 49 and I am 55 now and I had all those years of suffering, going to the ER when meds at home could not control the pain and of course for me none of the migraine meds worked. the thing I notice most I can not tolerate anything carbonated.  NO COKES. but I suppose in the long run that is not a bad thing.  if you haven't tried it please do so.  my neurologist called it dopamax for a reason. for the first 2 weeks I was loopy and sort of confused but I believe that was my body getting used to the med.  but after that no problem.  try it I think you will be  migraine free.  I know I am . and I am very happy
Caused weight loss as well as major hair loss. I lost four inches or more in hair over a year period.

Topamax (topiramate):I took Topamax a few years ago and regret it. It has changed my life for the worse. I started taking this medication for migraines yesterday although I was prescribed it about a month ago. Topamax (topiramate):I seemed to catch everything while I was on this rx. Topamax (topiramate):I was getting 10-12 migraines a month when I was prescribed Topamax.  I took it for a little over a month but had to quit because it made me extremely depressed and suicidal.  After I stopped taking it, I felt fine again.

Topamax (topiramate):I cannot recommend this medication. Yes it did prevent migraines but the side-effects far outweighed the benefit. Topamax (topiramate):I have not had good luck with this medicine. The side effects were horrible at first but they did settle down and mostly disappeared after 4 or 5 months on the medication. If you're just starting it, give it some time and the side effects will go away, but for me it never helped lessen or decrease my migraines so now my doc has given me Amitriptyline to try so I'm hoping I have better luck with this one!!

Topamax (topiramate):I started having migraines a week after starting the birth control pill as a teen. I was just at the point of quitting it when I lost my job so I had no choice. The reason I was quitting it was that I lost SO MUCH WEIGHT that I looked anorexic! And soon realized that my memory was  HORRIBLE!

Topamax (topiramate):This is the 2nd time in 10 yrs a neurologist has put me on Topomax.  I am on 125 mg a day.  The side effects are horrible and the migraines are worse than ever.  Neuro refuses to take me off it after I have told him I do not like this drug or its many side effects.  I was told I was a lost cause.

Topamax (topiramate):I have had estrogen- and barometric migraine since my mid-twenties. I was noticing that the intensity & frequency of said migraines were getting worse over time (I'm 47 now). I was over-presrcribed Imitrex & was having rebound migraines, suffering 20  migraines/mo. So far, I've been on this med for a little over 2 weeks, & am on 25 mg. I'm in peri menopause & have noticed that I get a migraine around the time of my period, but it's about a 5 or 6 instead of a 10 . So far is working w/very few & side effects.

Topamax (topiramate):I started Topamax on August 18th and my life has changed! Today is September 2nd, two weeks without a migraine is a miracle. I’m on 50mg. At first I was having a hard time at work. Brain fog is an understatement. But I would say it’s gone now. Within the first week my sensitivity to light disappeared. I actually started crying tears of joy while driving because I could finally see in the day time without migraine. And same thing at night. I don’t have to turn the mirror up anymore. I can see! I occasionally get some tingling in my hands and feet but not bad at all. I will update again on my progress/side effect in a month or two. Good luck to everyone. This has been such a blessing for me.

I must say for its intended use yes it should get a 10. However I have experienced the worse side effects ever from this medication from Pop tasting flat and  metallically, tingly fingers and toes, UTI (that don't show up on and doctors test) anger, depression (with no history of depression before),  anxiety, hot flashes, and that just a few. I am 33 years old and was given this for a preventative for my migraines and not sure if I'd rather have my migraines or not at this point.

I've been on topiramate for about 9 months and I've had really weird side-effects. Topamax (topiramate):I have been on Topamax for about 6 months for Migraines.  I take 50mg per day.
